Fields.DialogueText: Houston, I've been looking all over for you.
What is this mess? Looks like you've taken that AA gun completely apart.
Not completely, Captain! The guts are still intact. Little fella was shootin' fairly poor, and I decided he could use a tune up.
Well, finish up soon. The Morganas are moving into position, and we're prepping for the offensive.
Good, I can't wait to give the brujah what for. Teach them to come into my sea!
I'm glad you're prepared for this. I have a special assignment for you. I need you taking point in this battle.
I get it, Cap! You want one of your sternest Belles to take the fight to those monsters. Well, you can count on me!

Fields.MenuText: Make sure you stay with the fleet. We don't need you playing hero, just doing your part.
Whoa, there - I think you might be just a little bit too excited. Don't do anything crazy out there.
That's what I like to hear, Houston. Go out there and give the Morganas hell.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't need to play nothin', but don't worry. I ain't gonna put the fleet in danger just to show off.
I ain't as wild as all that, but I sure as hell ain't pullin' punches with the brujah.
Damn right, Cap! We'll break 'em down into pieces and let 'em sink to the bottom. I want them to know it was me that did it!
Good, now get that gun back together. We've got a battle to fight and I want you in top shape.
You got it, Cap! Be right as rain in a minute, and ready to kick some rear.
@BATTLE
Howdy, Cap! Have a favor to ask you, if you got a minute. I wanted to make a stop on our trip.
I'm not sure, Houston. Where were you thinking about going?
I wanted to ramble on over to the Philippines for a bit, see some old friends and show the flag.
This isn't a pleasure cruise, Houston. We swore an oath not to interfere with the land war.
Oh, I know. I ain't trying to fight a war on the sly. But I've got friends there, and I'm not likin' the idea that the brujah are hittin' em while we're all busy.
Ah, I see.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure we can modify our routes to take us through the Philippines at some point in the near future.
I'm not sure it's in the cards, but we can do our best to reach out and see if anybody knows anything.
Come on, I need you to keep your mind on our mission. We can't afford distractions out here.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Cap. It means a lot to me. I still got a responsibility to the people out here, you know?
That's better than nothin', I suppose. Thanks for your time, Cap. I hope we get good news, but I doubt it.
I ain't askin' for much and you know it. So you can shut your yap, can't ya?
*ALARM*
We'll talk about this later. I can hear the alarm, so get ready for a fight.
I'm almost insulted, Cap! I'm always ready for a scrap!
@BATTLE
Hello there, Houston. You look happier than usual today. Mind if I ask what's happening?
Got a care package from the folks back in Shiner, and now there's a case of cold ones chilling in the mess.
Oh, I see. Any intention of sharing those with the crew? Or the captain?
Not on your life, Cap. D'you know how hard it is to get these beauties out here? You can get your own beer, thank you very much.
Not very hospitable of you, Houston. I thought you'd be happy to share with your friends.
Maybe we ain't friends then. Especially if you're just gonna sit there and try to mooch beer offa me.
I apologize for nothing.

Fields.MenuText: That said, pace yourself. I don't want you getting drunk before a battle.
I'm not going to come out and call you a heartless and unfeeling monster, but consider it strongly implied.
Tell you what, though. How about the next time I get a shipment of my favorite beer, we can trade a few bottles?

Fields.DialogueText: Hey now, Cap, I ain't gonna get outta my head just 'cause I poured down a couple a cold ones.
Hah, you sold me, Cap. I suppose I can spare one if it'll soothe your breakin' heart. Do you like blondes or bocks?
I suppose that's a fair trade. You let me know when your package comes in, and we can make the swap.
*ALARM*
Whoo boy! There's the alarm, looks like we got some work to do on the brujah first!
@BATTLE
Look at the brujah running! They ain't got a patch on us!
Houston, you're getting out of position. If we extend ourselves too far, we won't be able to regroup with the rest of the fleet.
I know my business, Cap. Let me do my job. One more good volley and we'll start to get back with the others.
That kicked ‘em good! All right Cap, pulling back now. Don't want to leave the girls without a protector looking after them, do we?
That was reckless, Houston. What if the Morganas had reinforcements waiting, or a trap of some kind?
It ain't reckless, it's prudent. We know there's a couple a fleets out here, and they'll be tendin' their wounds for some time to come.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I'm glad we managed to hit them this hard, but I'm still worried about the strategy of it.
Good point. We certainly sent this group home crying, and that'll make the next fight easier.
It was still dangerous. We'd already done enough damage to them.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, quit worrying and let me do my business. I know what I'm about, Cap, so trust me.
We'll break the next one, too, and the one after that, and the one after that, until they ain't nothing but a sack a parts.
Aw, come on, Cap. Don't be afraid to get your hands dirty!
*ALARM*
There's the alarm. Looks like we can put your idea to the test right away.
Wooo! We'll give the brujah another whoopin'!
@BATTLE
Hey there, Cap! What brings you down to the mess?
I could ask you the same question, but my answer was the smell. Everyone in the crew was talking about it.
Oh, you like that? I been smoking this brisket for at least three hours now, oughta be ready before too much longer.
I didn't know you were a chef, Houston. Is this a regular treat aboard? I can't imagine it's easy to get the meat here.
You got that right. Ain't no picnic getting it fresh, and I've had to learn to cook some interestin' game. I think the crocodile was the strangest one. Tasty, though.
Ain't a chef, though, and I don't barbecue too often, but the real cook and I got a little setup where we can smoke anything I get my hands on.

Fields.MenuText: I strenuously endorse this setup. Whatever you have in there smells delicious, and I can't wait to get a bite of it.
I'm not sure this is the best use of your time, but whatever I'm smelling in there has to be worth the effort.
I'm sure the crew loves it. I can't imagine it being anything less than delicious.

Fields.DialogueText: Who said you could have a bite, Cap? Just joshing ya! I'll let you know when it's done, although I ain't savin' you a seat.
Of course it's the best use a my time! It's barbecue, ain't it? My belly ain't gonna wait for the war to end before it starts grumblin'.
Good to know your imagination's workin' properly, because this might be my best idea yet. We'll see how it comes out, though.
*ALARM*
Looks like you'll have to put it on hold for a bit. Time to go fight that war.
Don't the brujah know how delicate this process is? I'm gonna teach those annoying BFs a lesson.
@BATTLE
Hello, Houston. I assume you're here about the course changes for the fleet that just went through?
Looks like we're gonna skirt right by the Philippines. What lit a fire under us?
We received reports that a major Morgana fleet is active in the area, and it looks like dealing with that is going to be our responsibility.
You're darn right it's our responsibility. I'm the flag of the Asiatic Fleet, so ain't nothin' happenin' to the people there while I'm around.
I'm glad you're so gung ho about it. We'll have a better idea of what we're up against once we get closer, but we should be encountering trailing elements soon.
Let me at 'em, Cap! I'll teach the brujah not to mess with the Rambler's friends.

Fields.MenuText: The Rambler? Is that you? How do you even get a nickname like that? What does it mean?
Don't get too excited, but I'm sure you'll get your chance soon enough, Rambler. What a strange name.
Remember, you're part of a team here, so we're going to work together to keep people safe. Do you understand, Rambler?

Fields.DialogueText: It's... like a drifter, or a traveler. Someone who rambles around a fair bit. Which I've done well enough.
Hey, I don't make fun of you, Cap. So get your head outta your butt, and we'll cause some trouble for the brujah.
Part of a team? Cap, I'm the heart a the team. Now get over it, we got a war to fight.
*ALARM*
It's gotta be my lucky day, because there's the alarm! Time to raise some hell, Cap!
I can't argue with that, Houston. Let's hit them hard.
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap! Can I grab you for a minute? Got something from the radio boy you oughta hear.
All right, let's head up to the bridge and I'll listen to it.
No need, Cap, got one right here. I figured you'd wanna hear it right away.
Kailangan namin ng tulong. Mayday, mayday. Kailangan namin ng tulong. Mayday, mayday. Kailangan namin ng tulong. Mayday, mayday.
It's repeating, Cap. The part in Tagalog is, "We need help." We need your permission to try and make contact, as it could give away the fleet's position.
Do so. Do you have any idea who could be broadcasting out here?
I'm not sure, but "mayday" is an American disaster call. There's some American influence there.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose we won't know more until we meet them, so there's no use worrying about it.
Remember, we can't get involved in the land engagements out here.
Be prepared for anything, Houston. This could be a Morgana trap. We have to be cautious.

Fields.DialogueText: That's pretty smart thinking for you, Cap. I'm almost impressed with ya.
I know, Cap, I know. But if it's the brujah, I'm itching to tear them apart, especially if they've been hurtin' my friends.
If it is, we'll smash through it like a ragin' bull. Sooner or later they'll figure out they ain't gonna stop the Rambler.
All right, come around. We'll head towards the source of that signal as soon as we can.
@BATTLE
Hey-o, Cap! I heard you found a fishing boat that belonged to the fellas who sent out the SOS.
That's right, Houston. We're questioning one of the fishermen right now. It's the strangest thing, though.
What's that, Cap? Ain't too strange to be out fishin'.
Not that. They were terrified and refusing to talk until they saw you. Then, suddenly, they opened right up.
Nothin' strange about that, Cap! They probably saw me before, last time I was around the area. Nice to be remembered.
Interesting. Would you mind bringing them aboard, then?

Fields.MenuText: It's more likely we'll get something useful out of them if they trust their surroundings.
They might prefer to be somewhere familiar.
I don't know them, and I want them somewhere they can be watched by someone that I trust.

Fields.DialogueText: Seems fair, Cap. A little bit shady, but definitely fair. I'm happy havin' them aboard.
Go ahead and send 'em over to me, I can get 'em comfy.
Fair 'nuff, Cap. Send 'em on over and we'll get 'em bedded down somewhere nice and snug.
I appreciate that, Houston. Now look sharp. We've got reports of further Morgana elements to the east.
I always look sharp, Cap. Let's go put them brujah in their places!
@BATTLE
Hello, Houston! Learn anything from your new passengers?
Ain't passengers, Cap. Got 'em set up with the crew, and they're workin' alongside us.
Is that a fact? My mistake, Houston. Did you learn anything from your new sailors?
Four new swears, my favorite eats on the Manila docks closed down, they can't play cards for beans, and their grandma's recipe for tapas.
Houston, work with me here.
All right, Cap. It looks like there's a big brujah named Sabotage steamin' around these parts, sinking every boat she finds floatin' and a fair number of other things as well.
And when you eat a lotta fish, that ain't great, so the folks who're already pretty pressed by the war 're gettin' desperate.
Apparently, they had to come out here to get the message out, because Sabotage's doin' something to radios when she's around, makin' 'em scream and such.

Fields.MenuText: Good work, Houston. It looks like we've got a real fight on our hands here.
That's going to be trouble. We need to be able to communicate to fight effectively. We may have to suspend night operations.
I'm glad they were worth more than a recipe and a few hands of poker.

Fields.DialogueText: Lookin' forward to it, Cap! Gonna show that brujah who's the queen around here.
I can almost guarantee that'll be when she hits us, too, the cowardly little snake in the grass.
Hey now, Cap, I got me some primo gossip as well. That's worth it by itself.
*ALARM*
There's the alarm. Let's go give these BFs a taste before they get wise and leg it.
@BATTLE
Houston, there you are. Put that bottle away. I've got work for you.
I can work just fine with a cold one, Cap. What do you need?
These are unfamiliar waters for a lot of us. I need you to prepare a briefing for the rest of the crew about what to expect.
What, you mean like the squalls and such that blow through?
That's exactly what I mean. We all need to know what might happen out here.
I suppose, Cap, but I don't really want to. That sounds like an awful lot of writin' and the sound of it is already makin' my hand cramp.

Fields.MenuText: That wasn't a request, Houston.
You're the best woman for the job. You've got the experience and people listen to you.
No one can do it better than you. You know more about these waters than everyone on the ship combined.

Fields.DialogueText: If it means that much to you... all right. But you owe me a pack of Dublin Dr. Pepper.
Well, I do command a certain amount of respect. I suppose I can make it happen, Cap.
All right, all right, you convinced me. I'll get it done, Cap. You can count on me.
Good, now get ready. We've got another Morgana sighting and we're going to head out.
Hah, we can make that sight go away real quick.
@BATTLE
Cap, I want to request we bring the ship in close to land for a bit.
I'm not sure I see the tactical advantage in doing so, Houston. Is there something you want to see?
More something I want to do, Cap. I know a lot of Filipinos who're handy on deck. We've been taking a beatin' and could use their help.
You're not wrong. We've been at sea for a while now, and we could use a hand.
Good deal, Cap. I'll tell the lads we picked up to get ready. They'll round up some folk to shore up our numbers.
Just make sure that's all you do out there.

Fields.MenuText: Remember, we can't break neutrality here. There's too much at stake.
Get as many people and as many supplies and food as you can. We'll be putting all of it to good use.
I don't want you getting us dragged into another fight.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, Cap. I don't like it, but I know.
I don't doubt it, Cap. We'll give these people a chance to fight the good fight.
I'll be careful, Cap. I promise. I don't want another war on our hands, any more than you do.
All right, Houston, then we're agreed. We'll push through the Morgana fleet elements protecting the coast and then hit the ports.
Sounds like a plan, Cap! Let's bust some heads!
@BATTLE
Do you have that briefing finished, Houston? We've been having some weather issues.
That'll happen, Cap, but yeah, we've got a pretty good write up. I'm hopin' it's what you're lookin' for.
All right, let me see it. I'm sure you did a good job.
So, it looks like we're going into lots of squalls, rain, and wind with very little warning.
That's about the size of it, Cap. I got a fair amount a experience reading the lay of the land, but it'll get ya.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think you could talk to some of the crew and make sure they know what to look for?
Would you like a more forward position so you can spot for such things? It'd be good to have an experienced hand leading the way.
I'm sure we'll muddle through. You've provided plenty of information, so the crew will be prepared.

Fields.DialogueText: Sure thing, Cap, always happy to instruct.
Sounds good, Cap. I'll ride herd for a while and make sure we know what's coming.
I did my best, Cap. It's all I can do.
You have my thanks, Houston. You're doing a lot to make sure this fleet is safe.
Well, I know it wasn't because I asked, but I still feel a lot a responsibility for us being out here. And for the people out here.
*ALARM*
I understand. There's the alarm! I suppose it's time to do some good things.
@BATTLE
Houston, there you are, I've been trying to get you over the radio all day. What's happening?
I couldn't tell you, Cap, I ain't been about much today. Odd nobody came and found me.
The radios on the ship have been out of whack and emitting static.
Son of a gun, Cap! Static! That's what the boys were talkin' about, that brujah Sabotage must be ‘round here somewhere!
You're right! Run the flags so we can signal the other ships. We need to pull together.
On it, Cap! What do you want me to tell them?

Fields.MenuText: Bring everyone together and push forward, we need to smash through them.
Pull back, across the fleet. We need to wheel and make sure we aren't heading into a trap.
Slow everyone down. We need to try and find Sabotage before we get blindsided. Signal to everyone and watch the other ships.

Fields.DialogueText: On it, Cap! We'll show these greenhorns they shouldn't have messed with us!
If you say so, Cap. We'll come back for 'em next time.
You got it, Cap. We'll find the brujah before she gets the drop on us.
Cap! We spotted the enemy fleet, and they're cuttin' us off! What do you want to do?
Push through. We can take them on.
@BATTLE
Houston, do we have a situation report? Are the radios working again?
Yeah, Cap, everything's back in working order. Helluva scare from Sabotage, though. We should'a been ready.
Yes, we should've. We will need to be ready next time. I want you to figure out a better way for us to communicate when we get into her range again.
Lotta pressure there, Cap... but, yeah, I'll do my best. Sorta my responsibility.
No, it's my responsibility. But I need your help figuring this out.
Yeah, all right, Cap. I just feel like I let people down, is all. You've been askin' me for help with stuff, and I ain't quite figured out how to do all of it.

Fields.MenuText: You've never let anybody down, not once. Just keep the insights coming, please.
I appreciate everything you've done, Houston. You're a credit to your country and your fleet, but this is not something any of us were ready for.
Figure it out, Houston. We can't afford indecision right now, with everything against us.

Fields.DialogueText: All right, Cap, as a personal favor. Ain't nothin' too hard for me, after all.
Yeah, I suppose so, Cap. All I can do is my best, after all.
Shut up, Cap, I'm doing my best. You keep your shirt on, and I'll figure out how to get around this problem.
Good. Now do me a favor and radio the rest of the fleet, and make sure we form up properly.
Bad news, Cap, radio's out again. We got another fight on our hands.
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap! Glad I found ya! I've got a present for you.
Is that right? Is it the method to keep the fleet from communicating during the radio outages?
Better! I decided, seein' as we're havin' a pretty tough time of it, I'd go ahead and supplement the crew's rations a bit.
Oh yeah, more barbecue? I'm sure they'll love that. Did you get the meat on land?
No sir, Cap. I decided to crack open my personal supply of beer.
Really, Houston? You were protective of it, last time I checked.
Of course, Cap! The bounty of Shiner, Texas belongs to all the good men and women aboard this ship. Might pick up their spirits a bit.

Fields.MenuText: That's very kind of you, Houston. I'm sure this will pick up their spirits.
It's funny. I was just saying to myself, what we really need in stressful, confusing times is a bunch of sailors who can't shoot straight.
I'm happy I'll get to finally drink one myself.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the beauty of it, Cap. I wanna share the joys of Texas with the world.
Come on, Cap, a beer or two isn't gonna get the whole fleet drunk under the table.
I'm happy to help you fulfill your dreams, Cap. Ain't I the best you ever met?
I can agree with that. I'll start making the arrangements to get them spread out through the ship.
*ALARM*
That's the alarm, maybe it'll have to wait a minute.
@BATTLE
Hello down there, Houston! I thought that might be you. What's that you're playing?
It's a harmonica, Cap. Been playin' them out on the range pretty much forever, 'cause they're easy to carry.
I like it. Do you play it often? I haven't noticed the sound before.
I try to practice everyday, usually down by the engines. I can play it down there and not have to worry about being heard.
Is that shyness I hear? I never thought I'd find the thing you didn't show off at every opportunity.
I ain't good yet, so playin' it where folk can hear me makes me nervous.

Fields.MenuText: That's fair. Still, maybe someday you'll give a concert to the men to lift their spirits.
I'm sure, once you're proficient, you'll never stop playing. Although I'm not sure what the crew will have to say about that...
I can understand that. I hope you have fun practicing.

Fields.DialogueText: Hah, maybe someday, maybe someday. Ain't in the cards right now, at least.
Cap, you are teetering on the edge of me giving you a whooping.
I certainly do, and it makes me pretty happy.
Either way, Houston, we're coming up on some Morgana activity, so be prepared for a fight.
@BATTLE
Cap, I need to talk to you. I'm starting to feel like I'm outta my depth here.
What's wrong? How's the planning coming for the alternate communication system?
That's just it, I got nothin'! I been wracking my brain, and there just ain't no way to work fast enough to get messages up and down the fleet.
That's... disappointing. What have you got instead, then?
I got a little bit a luck there, Cap. My plan is to just run us through a bunch of drills, so we all know what to do when the fight starts.
That's not a bad idea, actually. Let's work our way through those...

Fields.MenuText: How thoroughly do we need to plan for these to make sure we're prepared for the unexpected?
We have a few protocols for lack of communication, but they're mostly centered on one ship losing radio, so they need an overhaul.
That's a fine stopgap, but I need you working on the alternative communications too.

Fields.DialogueText: We need a lot a plans, Cap, but I think we can do with a few general ones.
I noticed, Cap. Been readin' through them and know I ain't impressed with the plans we had. Especially 'cause each nation has their own.
All right, Cap. I'll go ahead and do everything. You got a one legged man to put in this butt kickin' contest, or is it just me?
*ALARM*
Just keep up the good work, Houston. Get ready, I hear the alarm.
@BATTLE
All right, time to test the new protocols. Remember, we have a plan, and we have a plan for when that fails.
I hear it, Cap, don't worry. Half of this was my idea, so we'll be fine.
I certainly hope so. It looks like radio contact was just lost with the fleet, so Sabotage is nearby.
Well, what're we waiting for? Let's hound that brujah outta her little hole and smash her to bits.
I'm glad you're confident, Houston. If nothing else, we can always smash through on sheer bravado.
Well now, Cap, ain't that my specialty? Let's see if we can't make her day worse.

Fields.MenuText: I appreciate your willingness to leap into danger like this.
Don't get too cocky, we'll need to be pretty careful if we want this to work.
That's the spirit, Houston. Let's just smash them to pieces and worry about the specifics in the after action report.

Fields.DialogueText: Sometimes you just need to step up, Cap. And I'm the one for the job.
Yeah, yeah, yeah, Cap. We'll stick to the plan and make sure everyone makes it through.
Yer finally coming around, Cap. Let's beat them soundly.
All right, we need to stop the chatter and get our heads in the game, we have a visual on Sabotage.
@BATTLE
Congratulations, Houston! Your tactics worked, and we smashed that witch to pieces.
Yeah, Cap, but she'll be back, and madder than hell when she is.
True, but we have the tactics to at least stand a chance for a while longer.
She's greasy as fried lard, so she'll come up with a way to derail our train sooner rather than later.
True, so get started on another set of tactics, all right?
Sure, sure, pull a few brand new, innovative tricks outta my hat before we need them, whenever that is.

Fields.MenuText: Exactly, get right on it.
Don't be grumpy about it, Houston. Nobody said war would be easy.
If you can't handle it, I can give the job to someone else.

Fields.DialogueText: Yer a real piece a work, you know that, Cap? I'm gonna do it just to spite you now.
Nope, I was told I'd be given brisket, shrimp, beer, and Dublin Dr Pepper every day and a nice weekend at the Rice Hotel.
Oh, don't even start, Cap. I'll whoop you and make sure this gets done.
That's what I thought. Keep at it, Houston, and we'll see if we can't push these monsters back.
Damn right, we'll beat the brujah at their own game.
@BATTLE
Houston I need you to... what's that in your hair?
Buttercups, Cap! They're my favorite flower, and I got a little pot I grow them in.
That's actually very pretty, Houston. I hadn't really thought you were the type.
Cap, I don't care if I look like a plains princess - I'll tan your hide.
Okay, okay, I didn't mean to make you upset. I was just surprised is all, and I wanted to compliment you.
Well, thank you, Cap. It's nice to see you can be a decent sort.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean "can be"? I'm almost as good a person as you are.
What do you mean "decent"? I'm a bastion of command and personal power.
Thank you for the compliment, Houston, I never thought I'd see the day.

Fields.DialogueText: Almost, Cap. That's somethin' to strive for. Maybe someday you'll get on my level.
Sure you are, Cap, sure you are. Keep up the good work, huh? We can't do this without ya.
Oh hush, Cap. I don't need your sass right now.
*ALARM*
Oh dang it, there's the alarm. Time to go to war again.
Whatever you say, princess.
@BATTLE
All right, by the numbers, Houston. We need to take this easy.
You got it, Cap. I'll take point and make sure we come through okay.
We need to fight it out here, if we can push them back we can get to port long enough to link up with the civilians again.
You don't have to tell me twice, Cap. We're gonna make sure my friends're okay.
We can do this, Houston. Don't worry, your friends will be safe.
I know, Cap. We just have to make sure they can't corner us.

Fields.MenuText: Just stick to the plan and we'll all get through. This is a solid strategy, and we can hit them before they get ready.
That's right, keep it together and make sure you stick with the rest of the fleet.
If they do, we'll need to call it off and break out.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, Cap. We'll be just fine. Let's fight through it and help these folks.
I know, Cap. Don't worry, I'll keep an eye on the others and make sure we get through as a group.
I know, Cap. I don't like it, but I know. I'll be smart.
Radios just went out... get ready.
Aye aye, Cap! Let's bring the stampede.
@BATTLE
These recent fights have been rough. Are you okay, Houston?
I'll live. A lotta my boys won't, though.
Well, at least we made it. We can resupply and find a few more hands willing to serve on deck.
Not that I ain't grateful for gettin' my copains off this island, but I wish it didn't have to be like this.
Don't worry about that right now. Just thank your lucky stars that the truce is protecting us.
I feel about as lucky as a blind man crossing the street, but I see your point.

Fields.MenuText: All right, you've been here before. I want you to be responsible for taking aboard the new crew and supplies.
Can you stay in port and keep an eye out for Morgana activity? I don't want us getting surprised.
We're sitting ducks here, so do whatever you need to get us supplied as fast as possible.

Fields.DialogueText: You got it, Cap. I know a few people who will be a real help to us.
Sure thing, Cap. I don't want us gettin' sunk in port.
I'll have us nice and ready as soon as possible.
Damn, looks like a sighting on the perimeter of the bay. We need to push them back so we can resupply.
Them brujah ain't never let a body rest, do they? Let's do this.
@BATTLE
Houston, have you finished talking to the Filipino and Japanese delegations?
Sure have, Cap. They ain't too happy about takin' direction from an American girl, and they ain't too happy about working with each other, but they'll help us.
And the new sailors? How are they fitting in?
About the same, Cap. Ain't too happy to see us or each other, but they sure as hell hate Sabotage, so they're puttin' up with it.
Good, as long as they're abiding by the truce, I don't care what they grumble about.
They got a chip on their shoulders the size a half of Texas, but yeah, they're abiding.

Fields.MenuText: They'll learn to work together in time, everyone else has. We can put up with it until then.
If we have any discipline cases, we'll deal with them. Otherwise, we need to live with it.
Make it known that any disagreements are going to be settled by me, and my ass-kicking boots are shined.

Fields.DialogueText: That's fair, the fleet's just a big ol' burrito, ain't it? We'll be just fine.
As long as we don't die from it. We'll keep it together, Cap.
Got some bite to ya, Cap! Didn't know you had it in you.
*ALARM*
Whatever it takes to keep the fleet fighting. Is that the alarm?
They're in the bay, Cap. Let's push them back again.
@BATTLE
All right Houston, full speed ahead. We're going to smash through them and back out to open water.
Radio's out, Cap. Sabotage's here.
Let's do it, signal the fleet. We're going to hit them as hard as we can.
Captain, there's a squall boiling up!
What, now?! Damn it, do we have a plan for that?
Sure thing, Cap, full speed ahead, and hold onto your hat!
@BATTLE
We're pushing through! But we're losing contact with the fleet!
I know, Cap! This is the plan! Hang on!
*BOOM*
Agh, she got me! I ain't liking this.
Houston, your engines are on fire! I don't remember any of this in the plan!
This gully washer ain't gonna stop us! I got momentum, guns, grit, and we're gonna get through this!
*BOOM*
Got her! Take that, you brujah! Get outta my way!

Fields.MenuText: Well, that was reckless and stupid.
You did it! I don't believe it, but you did it! We're through, and it looks like the storm is blowing off.
We're still alive? Remind me never to play poker with you, Houston.

Fields.DialogueText: Quit your bellyaching, Cap. We sure as hell weren't gettin' outta there alive without someone risking their hide. Might as well be us.
Damn right, I did it! Ain't nothing on the water that can stop me. Well, after we get that engine fixed.
You shouldn't do that anyway, I'll win the shirt off your back and swagger off to the Pleasure Pier.
All right, Sabotage and her fleet are down for now, so I'll radio the fleet and we'll try to meet up on the other side of the storm.
Get me an engineer or a tow while you're at it, all right, partner?
No, no. I meant it as a compliment.
Great, just when we were getting that tow set up... Battle stations, everyone!
@BATTLE
Another bunch of the BF's Finest bites the dust.
I never did ask. That craziness you did with Sabotage, how did you know it would work?
I didn't, but even limpin', I'll tan a scoundrel's hide. Speakin' of, I oughta thank those fishin' boats again for the tow they gave me earlier.
You really do have friends all over, don't you? I was impressed the Japanese and Filipino civilians all wanted to help you.
What can I say, Cap? I'm a personable gal, and it pays to have friends in low places.
Fair enough, I can see the proof already. You sure you're back at one hundred percent?
I can fight right now, and I'll whoop you if you say I can't, darlin'.
I ain't got the thickest armor in the world, but it stopped most a that shell, so it was busywork for the boys with the wrenches. I think they trained the new crew, too.
That's smart, I suppose we have a little bit of downtime at the moment.
Don't jinx it, partner, I'm starting to enjoy it. Let a woman let her hair down for a minute.

Fields.MenuText: All right, whatever you say, partner. Glad you're on my side.
Now that, I think, is something that I would very much like to see, Houston. Why don't I grab you a cold one?
